rn.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include <rossnet.h>
00002 #include <rn_config.h>
00003 
00004 /*
00005  * Each RN lp is an instance of a machine which employs the OSI model.
00006  * The modules implement the functionality of the OSI model layers which
00007  * have been defined in the ./configure step.
00008  *
00009  * The functional link between the models and the RN core is the rn_lptype.
00010  * Each rn_lptype will register functions for the init, event_handler, RC
00011  * event handler and final routines.  The RN lp will call these functions
00012  * but impose on them the OSI model structure.  In this way the layers will
00013  * be reproduced in the proper order.  This will enforce the upstream/downstream
00014  * motion of packets within a machine, including de/muxing.
00015  * 
00016  * The RN lp will also be responsible for transmitting lateral rn_messages, which
00017  * are defined to be rn_messages between RN machines.  When the rn_message is at the
00018  * bottom-most layer of the OSI model, the RN lp will then handle the sending of
00019  * remote rn_message to another RN lp.  This will model the sending of packets between
00020  * two machines on a network, thus completing the physical layer of the 
00021  * OSI model.  This should also ensure
00022  * that the module development integration is smooth as individual modules should
00023  * not be sending packets directly, which is hard for them to do anyway because they
00024  * will never know the bottom-most layer type on the remote  machine.  The RN lp
00025  * will not know this either.  In fact, it will simply send an RN rn_message to the
00026  * other RN lp, and the other RN lp will be responsible for handling that rn_message's
00027  * upstream motion on the remote machine.
00028  *
00029  * This will facilitate the different layering on different types of 
00030  * machines on the network: hosts, routers, gateways, and future, unforeseen machines.
00031  * This will also give the ability for any type of machine to fill in the entire
00032  * OSI model as each chooses.  For example, a gateway running BGP/TCP would fill
00033  * in the appropriate layers, but could fill in additional layers, such as an 
00034  * experimental application running above the BGP/TCP stack working on the BGP
00035  * data.
00036  */
00037 
00038 rn_lptype       layer_types[] = {

00156         /*
00157          * Init the rn lp, and then each of the protocol layer lps for this node.
00158          * Beyond setting up the ISO/OSI model, we also need to setup the star model.
00159          */
00160 unsigned int    g_rn_memory = 0;
00161 
00162 tw_peid
00163 rn_map(tw_lpid gid)
00164 {
00165         return (tw_peid) gid / g_tw_nlp;
00166 }
00167 
00168 void
00169 rn_startup(rn_lp_state * state, tw_lp * lp)
00170 {
00171         rn_machine     *m;
00172 
00173 #if RN_TIMING
00174         tw_wtime        start;
00175         tw_wtime        end;
00176         tw_wtime        run;
00177 
00178         tw_wtime        xml_start;
00179         tw_wtime        xml_end;
00180         tw_wtime        xml_run;
00181 
00182         tw_wtime        init_start;
00183         tw_wtime        init_end;
00184         tw_wtime        init_run;
00185 
00186         int             memory;
00187 
00188         tw_wall_now(&start);
00189         memory = sizeof(rn_lp_state);
00190 #endif
00191 
00192         if(0 == lp->id % 100000)
00193                 printf("Initializing RN lp %d \n", (int) lp->id);
00194 
00195         /* Our machine gives us all the configurables from the XML topology */
00196         m = rn_getmachine(lp->id);
00197 
00198         //rn_link_random_changes(lp);
00199         rn_setup_links(state, lp);
00200         rn_init_streams(state, lp);
00201 
00202         if(lp->id == g_tw_nlp - 1)
00203                 printf("Link status changes: %d \n", g_rn_nlink_status);
00204 
00205 #if RN_TIMING
00206         //memory += sizeof(tw_lp) * m->nlayers;
00207         tw_wall_now(&end);
00208         tw_wall_sub(&run, &end, &start);
00209         tw_wall_sub(&xml_run, &xml_end, &xml_start);
00210         tw_wall_sub(&init_run, &init_end, &init_start);
00211         g_rn_memory += memory;
00212 
00213         if (lp->id % 50 == 0)
00214         {
00215                 printf
00216                         ("rn lp %d: Done with startup, xml %f secs, init %f secs, overall %f secs\n",
00217                          lp->id, tw_wall_to_double(&xml_run), tw_wall_to_double(&init_run),
00218                          tw_wall_to_double(&run));
00219                 printf
00220                         ("rn lp %d: memory used for this lp %d, overall to now %d \n\n",
00221                          lp->id, memory, g_rn_memory);
00222         }
00223 #endif
00224 
00225         if(g_tw_nlp == lp->id)
00226                 printf("Initializing rn lps complete! \n");
00227 
00228         return;
00229 }
00230 
00231         /*
00232          * The forward computation event-handler routine
00233          */
00234 void
00235 rn_event_handler(rn_lp_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg, tw_lp * lp)
00236 {
00237 #if DYNAMIC_LINKS
00238         tw_event        *e;
00239 #endif
00240         tw_lp           *l;
00241 
00242 #if DYNAMIC_LINKS
00243         rn_message      *m;
00244 #endif
00245         rn_stream       *cur_stream;
00246 
00247         state->l_stats.s_nevents_processed++;
00248 
00249         /*
00250          * Timers need to be sent directly to the layer which set them
00251          */
00252         if (msg->type == TIMER)
00253         {
00254                 state->cev = NULL;
00255                 state->cur_lp = msg->timer;
00256                 cur_stream = rn_getstream_byport(state, msg->port);
00257                 cur_stream->cur_layer = msg->size;
00258 
00259 #if VERIFY_RN
00260                 printf("\n%ld RN: TIMER src %ld, port %ld, ts %lf \n\n",
00261                                 lp->id, msg->src, msg->port, tw_now(lp));
00262 #endif
00263 
00264                 (*msg->timer->type.event) (msg->timer->cur_state, bf, msg, lp);
00265 
00266                 return;
00267         } else if(msg->type == DIRECT)
00268         {
00269                 // handled in the same way as TIMER events
00270                 state->cev = NULL;
00271                 state->cur_lp = msg->timer;
00272                 cur_stream = rn_getstream_byport(state, msg->port);
00273                 cur_stream->cur_layer = msg->size;
00274 
00275                 state->cev = NULL;
00276                 state->cur_lp = &cur_stream->layers[0].lp;
00277                 cur_stream = rn_getstream_byport(state, msg->port);
00278                 cur_stream->cur_layer = 0;
00279 
00280 #if VERIFY_RN
00281                 printf("\n%ld RN: DIRECT src %ld, port %ld, ts %lf \n\n",
00282                                 lp->id, msg->src, msg->port, tw_now(lp));
00283 #endif
00284 
00285                 //(*msg->timer->type.event) (msg->timer->cur_state, bf, msg, lp);
00286                 (*state->cur_lp->type.event) (state->cur_lp->cur_state, bf, msg, lp);
00287 
00288                 return;
00289 
00290         } else if(msg->type == LINK_STATUS ||
00291                   msg->type == LINK_STATUS_DOWN ||
00292                   msg->type == LINK_STATUS_UP ||
00293                   msg->type == LINK_STATUS_WEIGHT)
00294         {
00295                 rn_link *l;
00296 
00297 #if VERIFY_RN
00298                 printf("%ld: link to %ld status change at %lf: %d -> %d \n",
00299                         lp->id, 
00300                         g_rn_machines[lp->id].link[msg->port].wire->id,
00301                         tw_now(lp),
00302                         g_rn_machines[lp->id].link[msg->port].status,
00303                         msg->type);
00304 #endif
00305 
00306                 l = &g_rn_machines[lp->id].link[msg->port];
00307 
00308                 if(msg->type == LINK_STATUS_WEIGHT)
00309                 {
00310                         tw_error(TW_LOC, "Link cost disabled!");
00311                         //l->cost = tw_rand_integer(lp->id, 1, 100);
00312                 } 
00313 #if DYNAMIC_LINKS
00314                 else if(msg->type == LINK_STATUS_DOWN)
00315                 {
00316                         l->status = rn_link_down;
00317                 } else if(msg->type == LINK_STATUS_UP)
00318                 {
00319                         l->status = rn_link_up;
00320                 } else
00321                 {
00322                         if(l->status == rn_link_up)
00323                                 l->status = rn_link_down;
00324                         else
00325                                 l->status = rn_link_up;
00326                 }
00327 
00328                 l->last_status = tw_now(lp);
00329                 l->next_status = INT_MAX;
00330 
00331                 /*
00332                  * If mode != once, then need to send the next 
00333                  * status change event here!
00334                  */
00335 
00336                 // If we took the link down, then bring it back up again
00337                 // a short time later
00338                 if(0 && msg->type == LINK_STATUS_DOWN)
00339                 {
00340                         rn_link *ol = rn_getlink(l->wire, lp->id);
00341 
00342                         if(ol->next_status > tw_now(lp))
00343                                 l->next_status = ol->next_status;
00344                         else
00345                                 l->next_status = tw_rand_integer(lp->id, floor(tw_now(lp)),
00346                                                          floor(tw_now(lp)) + 100);
00347 
00348                         e = tw_event_new(lp, l->next_status - tw_now(lp), lp);
00349                         m = tw_event_data(e);
00350 
00351                         m->timer = NULL;
00352                         m->port = msg->port;
00353                         m->src = lp->id;
00354                         m->dst = lp->id;
00355         
00356                         m->type = LINK_STATUS_UP;
00357 
00358                         tw_event_send(e);
00359 
00360                         printf("%ld: bringing link to %d up at time %lf (ns: %lf), now %lf\n", 
00361                                 lp->id, l->addr, e->recv_ts, l->next_status, tw_now(lp));
00362                 }
00363 #endif
00364 
00365                 return;
00366         }
00367 
00368         if(msg->type != UPSTREAM)
00369                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Did not get upstream event!");
00370 
00371         /*
00372          * This is where we traverse the star model:
00373          *
00374          * We need to start by finding the LP(s) which are on the port,
00375          * and the send up the list based on the port number.. I suppose
00376          * multiple layers could be using the same port at the same level,
00377          * so we need to handle that also.
00378          */
00379         cur_stream = rn_getstream_byport(state, msg->port);
00380 
00381         state->cev = lp->pe->cur_event;
00382         l = &cur_stream->layers[cur_stream->nlayers-1].lp;
00383         cur_stream->cur_layer = cur_stream->nlayers - 1;
00384         state->cur_lp = l;
00385 
00386         if(cur_stream->cur_layer == 0)
00387                 state->cev = NULL;
00388 
00389 #if VERIFY_RN
00390         printf("\n%ld RN: UPSTREAM src %ld, ts %lf \n",
00391                         lp->id, msg->src, tw_now(lp));
00392 #endif
00393 
00394         (*l->type.event) (l->cur_state, bf, msg, lp);
00395 }
00396 
00397         /*
00398          * The reverse computation event-handler routine
00399          */
00400 void
00401 rn_rc_event_handler(rn_lp_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg,
00402                                         tw_lp * lp)
00403 {
00404         tw_lp          *l;
00405 
00406         rn_stream       *cur_stream;
00407 
00408         state->l_stats.s_nevents_processed--;
00409 
00410         if (msg->type == TIMER)
00411         {
00412                 state->cur_lp = msg->timer;
00413 
00414                 (*msg->timer->type.revent) (msg->timer->cur_state, bf, msg, lp);
00415 
00416                 return;
00417         }
00418 
00419         cur_stream = rn_getstream_byport(state, msg->port);
00420         if (msg->type == UPSTREAM)
00421         {
00422                 l = &cur_stream->layers[0].lp;
00423                 state->cur_lp = l;
00424 
00425                 (*l->type.revent) (l->cur_state, bf, msg, lp);
00426         } else
00427         {
00428                 l = &cur_stream->layers[cur_stream->nlayers - 1].lp;
00429                 state->cur_lp = l;
00430 
00431                 (*l->type.revent) (l->cur_state, bf, msg, lp);
00432         }
00433 }
00434 
00435         /*
00436          * Collect the statistics from each LP
00437          */
00438 void
00439 rn_final(rn_lp_state * state, tw_lp * lp)
00440 {
00441         tw_lp           *l;
00442 
00443         rn_stream       *s;
00444 
00445         unsigned int i;
00446         unsigned int j;
00447 
00448         if(0 == lp->id % 100000)
00449                 printf("Finalizing RN lp %d \n", (int) lp->id);
00450 
00451         for (i = 0; i < state->nstreams; i++)
00452         {
00453                 s = &state->streams[i];
00454 
00455                 for(j = 0; j < s->nlayers; j++)
00456                 {
00457                         l = &s->layers[j].lp;
00458 
00459                         (*l->type.final) (l->cur_state, lp);
00460                 }
00461         }
00462 
00463         g_rn_stats->s_nevents_processed += state->l_stats.s_nevents_processed;
00464         g_rn_stats->s_nevents_rollback += state->l_stats.s_nevents_rollback;
00465 }
00466 
00467 tw_lptype       rnlps[] = {
00468         {
00469          (init_f) rn_startup,
00470          (event_f) rn_event_handler,
00471          (revent_f) rn_rc_event_handler,
00472          (final_f) rn_final,
00473          (map_f) rn_map,
00474          sizeof(rn_lp_state),
00475         },
00476         {0}
00477         ,
00478 };
00479 
00480 void
00481 rn_print_statistics()
00482 {
00483         tw_lpid  events;
00484 
00485         printf("\nROSS.Net Library Statistics: \n\n");
00486         printf("\t%-50s %11d\n", "Event Size", (int) g_tw_msg_sz);
00487         printf("\t%-50s %11d\n", "Total Events Processed",
00488                    g_rn_stats->s_nevents_processed);
00489 
00490         printf("\t%-50s %11d\n", "Events Rolled Back",
00491                    g_rn_stats->s_nevents_rollback);
00492         printf("\n");
00493 
00494         events = g_rn_stats->s_nevents_processed - g_rn_stats->s_nevents_rollback;
00495         printf("\t%-50s %11lld *\n", "Network Events Processed", events);
00496         printf("\t%-50s %11.2f (events/sec)\n", "Event Rate", 
00497                 (double) (events / g_tw_pe[0]->statistics.max_run_time));
00498 }

00500 const tw_optdef rn_opts [] =
00501 {
00502         TWOPT_GROUP("ROSS.Net Model"),
00503         TWOPT_UINT("link-prob", g_rn_link_prob, "link failure rate"),
00504         TWOPT_UINT("bgp", g_rn_converge_bgp, "pre-converge BGP model"),
00505         TWOPT_UINT("ospf", g_rn_converge_ospf, "pre-converge OSPFv2 model"),
00506         TWOPT_CHAR("log-dir", g_rn_logs_dir, "user specified log directory"),
00507         TWOPT_CHAR("topology", g_rn_xml_topology, "user specified XML config file"),
00508         TWOPT_CHAR("route-table", g_rn_rt_table, "user specified routing table"),
00509         TWOPT_CHAR("model", g_rn_xml_model, "user specified model"),
00510         TWOPT_CHAR("link-topology", g_rn_xml_link_topology, "user specified link topology"),
00511         TWOPT_CHAR("scenario", g_rn_tools_dir, "tools scenario"),
00512         TWOPT_END()
00513 };
00514 
00515         /*
00516          * Map LPs->KPs->PEs, 
00517          * initialize the ROSS engine, 
00518          * run the model, 
00519          * and print the model statistics.
00520          */
00521 int
00522 main(int argc, char **argv, char **env)
00523 {
00524         int              i;
00525 
00526         g_rn_stats = tw_calloc(TW_LOC, "RN Statistics", sizeof(*g_rn_stats), 1);
00527 
00528         g_rn_lptypes = layer_types;
00529 
00530         /* add command line args */
00531         tw_opt_add(rn_opts);
00532 
00533         /* Initialize ROSS */
00534         tw_init(&argc, &argv);
00535 
00536         rn_setup();
00537 
00538         /* init the XML package */
00539         rn_xml_init();
00540 
00541         /* RN configurables */
00542         g_rn_msg_sz = sizeof(rn_message);
00543 
00544 #ifdef HAVE_EPI_H
00545         g_tw_memory_nqueues += 1;
00546 #endif
00547 
00548 #ifdef HAVE_TCP_H
00549         g_tw_memory_nqueues += 1;
00550 #endif
00551 
00552 #ifdef HAVE_OSPF_H
00553         g_tw_memory_nqueues += 5;
00554 #endif
00555 
00556 #ifdef HAVE_IP_H
00557         g_tw_memory_nqueues += 1;
00558 #endif
00559 
00560 #ifdef HAVE_BGP_H
00561         g_tw_memory_nqueues += 3;
00562 #endif
00563 
00564         /* Initialize RN */
00565         if(0 == (rn_init(layer_types)))
00566                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "ROSS.Net could not be initialized. \n");
00567 
00568         /* ROSS configurables */
00569         g_tw_nlp /= tw_nnodes();
00570         g_tw_events_per_pe = g_tw_nlp * 40;
00571 
00572         tw_define_lps(g_tw_nlp, g_rn_msg_sz, 0);
00573 
00574         /* initialize the models */
00575         rn_models_init(layer_types, argc, argv, env);
00576 
00577         for(i = 0; i < g_tw_nlp; i++)
00578                 tw_lp_settype(i, &rnlps[0]);
00579 
00580         rn_init_lps(layer_types);
00581         rn_xml_end();
00582 
00583         tw_run();
00584 
00585         rn_models_final(layer_types);
00586         rn_print_statistics();
00587 
00588         return 0;
00589 }
